newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - Copper to consolidate, aluminium higher.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - Copper to consolidate, aluminium higher.

text.p: 3 MONTH CLOSE * SUPPORT * RESIST * RSI14 * MA10 * MA30
Copper prices are expected to consolidate on Tuesday but should maintain their recent upside bias despite over-extended signals, traders and chartists said.
Aluminium is expected to find support and may move higher following a constructive chart close on Friday, they added.

COPPER - Expected to consolidate above $2,500 and may test resistance at $2,550 despite its overbought condition. "Good support centred around $2,500 is preventing prices from aggressively testing the downside, although volatility in the $2,500/$2,550 range can be expected given that the RSI at 77.60 percent remains seriously overbought," LME brokers Brandeis said in their daily market review.
Support is likely to be found from a tight physical market which has seen nearby spreads remain tight. London Metal Exchange stocks are expected to register a small fall on Tuesday.
Harry Creates of AMT agreed that the market was over-extended and also believed that prices needed to consolidate before breaking higher. He pegged initial resistance at $2,530, followed by $2,550.
Following the long holiday weekend in the UK and U.S. three months copper was indicated at $2,513/18 versus Friday's late London close of $2,516/20.

ALUMINIUM - Friday's recovery from lows at around $1,610 has helped offset recent down-trending charts and suggests that prices may probe towards resistance at $1,650, market operators said on Tuesday.
But to rekindle significant upside momentum aluminium needs to overcome stiff resistance at $1,650 and heavy resistance up to $1,678.
On the downside good support is given by the convergence of the 30-day and 100-day moving averages at around $1,620, Brandeis said.
Martin Squires of Rudolf Wolff pegged support at $1,600/$1,590, while Creates of AMT said support was available at $1,610 and $1,595.
At 0725 GMT three months aluminium was indicated at $1,645/47, versus $1,634/37.
